case.state:
Whoa!
We haven't even started playing yet, ~player~!
Little early to be swinging {b}that{!reset} thing around, isn't it?

If you wanted to strip, then don't bother playing. I just wanted to play some poker...
{small}...And then strip.{!reset}
Whoa, isn't it a little early to be showing those off?

Ah, Lumiose City... I can already smell the amour in the air!

A game of strip poker in Kalos?
How oddly romantic...!
Ahhhh, Lumiose. It's like I never left! Anyone wanna go see Prism Tower after this game?
So this is a Game Corner, huh...? I kinda figured they'd have regular poker here.
...Tell me this isn't an actual classroom.
We're playing strip poker in a classroom? I dunno, something about it doesn't feel right.
Tell me this is at least a College classroom...
Ah, just like Undella Bay! Hope one of your Pokémon knows Surf!
Nothing like a nice, cozy beach... Wanna go toss Pyukumuku back into the ocean with me after the game?

Looks like it's all Unovans here...
I feel right at home!

Looks like we're all trainers here!
Any of you feel like a battle instead?
Was I that much fun to play against that you wanna do it again? I'm flattered!
Well hello again, ~player~. Ready for another game?
Y'know ~player~, I'm glad you wanna play against me again. I always have fun playing against you!

There's nobody I'd rather play against, ~player~!
{small}...well, at least friend-wise...{!reset}
Thanks for choosing me, ~player~! I'll give this my all!
I appreciate the invitation, ~player~! I'm going to give this 100% for you!
This'll be fun! I might be a Pokémon master, but I'm still a poker novice...
Alright ~player~, let's go! I'm always down for a good game!
It'd be rude of me to not give this my all, so get ready!
I'm still a trainer at heart, so I can never turn down a good challenge!
Hey ~player~, thanks for the call!
I was hoping to see you again, ~player~!
Thanks for keeping in touch with me, ~player~. It really means a lot.
I'm not late, am I ~player~?
Hey, has anyone seen my hat anywhere...?
...Did I leave my lucky hat here last time...?
This place has a Lost-and-Found somewhere, right? Can't find my hat anywhere...
Hey ~player~, you haven't seen my hat have you...?
There's a chill in the air tonight... Hope it doesn't make anyone too uncomfortable!
Mightyena tend to hunt in packs, you know... You're lucky that it's just me.
It's that season again, all the Ghost and Dark-types are coming out to play... Let's have a little fun!
There might not be any candy here, but I'll still have a great time!
No seriously, where's it gone...
That thing was a good luck charm, man...
C'mon, I've been wearing that hat since forever...
Aw man, that was my favorite hat, too...
It's gotta be around here somewhere...
Where'd I put my clothes last time...?
Ah, Elesa's here! Glad to see a familiar face.
Hey, Elesa! Good to see you here!
Hilda!? I saw your name, but I didn't think it'd really be you!
I'm having flashbacks to that battle in Undella Town...
Hold on, that's not... No, it couldn't be him.
That can't possibly be N, could it? What would he be doing in a place like this...?
Oh, hey May! How's Brendan doing, I haven't heard from him in a while!

...Hilda, what are you doing here--
...Whoops, my mistake.
You're Dawn, right? I heard about you while I was in Sinnoh, glad to finally meet you!
(Cynthia's here!? I hope she forgave me for walking into her place in Undella...)

Er, h-hi Cynthia...
You're just here to play poker, not battle anyone, right...?
Something's up with that girl in the silly hat... I don't know what, but I don't like it.
Something's... familiar about the girl in the Torchic hat, but I can't quite tell what...
I was surprised when I heard Hilda was going to be playing, but I guess you're a different Hilda!
Oh wait, you're not the Hilda I thought would be playing...

Hey Hilda, it's been a wh--
...Hey, where is she?
You're... A different Hilda than the one I thought I'd see here.
I swear, I know that scientist from somewhere...
That silly-haired science guy seems oddly familiar...
Oh hey, you're ~rosa~, right? I'm Hilbert, I've heard a lot about you!
That's the girl that stepped up to bat after I left Unova, isn't it...?

Hey, you're ~misty_hgss~, right? I've heard about you!
I may not have been able to challenge you while I was in Kanto, but at least I can challenge you here!
...Is that Elesa? Looks like her, but I can't quite tell...
Correct me if I'm wrong, but that I don't think that's what Flaafy evolve into...

Er... Nice Flaafy outfit, ma'am!

So that's what Wooloo evolves into...
This guy looks like trouble... I hope he doesn't start anything.

What the--
How the--
...what the hell?

What the--
How the--
...what the fuuuuuuuck?
My own clone...!?
What's going on here, is this someone's Ditto?
Is that a Zoroark...?
Me... From another universe!?
Quick, someone here ask me something that only I would know!
Caitlin, is that you? It's me, Hilbert! I took you and the rest of the Elite Four on after all that stuff with Team Plasma, remember?
Oh boy, another Faller... Please, tell me you managed to keep your memory...
There's a chill in the air tonight... Hope it doesn't make anyone too uncomfortable!
Mightyena tend to hunt in packs, you know... You're lucky that it's just me.
It's that season again, all the Ghost and Dark-types are coming out to play... Let's have a little fun!
There might not be any candy here, but I'll still have a great time!
You're bringing back all the wrong memories right now...
Won't be my first time defeating ~player~ for hurting ~n~...
I hope you knew what you were getting into when you picked that name...
I don't appreciate people hurting my friends, ~player~.
That's it... Just remember, you started this.

Did you call yourself that just to mess with me?

Son of a--

Oh hey, here it is!
Never mind, I found it!
Oh phew, I was starting to get worried...
Ahh, there you are... I missed you, lucky hat.

Wait, we have to {big}WHAT!?{!reset}
Wait, wait, wait... We have to do what...?

Suddenly, things make a lot more sense...
...I should've seen it coming sooner.
What a revelation... But I'm somehow unsurprised.
The Aspear doesn't fall far from the tree, does it.
...Please tell me you're not actually her mother...
...I'm going to hurl.
...Lady, you have no idea.
Please, ground her or something...
I wasn't even sure this level of awkwardness existed...
Wait, she's not...?

Whatever's going on here, I plan on getting to the bottom of it.
...Yes, I'll even strip if that's what it takes...
...You okay? I'm not fond of clowns either, but you seem like you've got some real big trauma...

No need to say that twice.
Allow myself to introduce... myself.
Hello me, meet the real me.

Walking, cycling, running... And nothing gets the blood pumpin' like a high-octane Pokémon Battle!

Oh shoot, is that a shiny Gastly?
...I'm gonna go out on a limb and say you're a Fairy-type Pokémon...
I'm *PBBTHBT* sorry, I can't *PTHBBT* understand *PHBBTH* your accent.
Er... 'Eeby Deeby' to you, too.
Er... Nice style, ~player~. You, uh, copying someone...?
Oh hey, we're twinning today!
Let me guess, this isn't just a phase...?

Waitasec--
N, is that you!?

...N, is that really you?
I've been looking all over for you, man! How have you been?
...N!? Of all the places to find you, I never thought it'd be at the ~background~!
...Hey ~player~, is that my hat you're wearing...?
...Nice hat, ~player~. Where'd ya get it...?
Hey ~player~, thanks for calling me over to play!

Hey ~player~, why didn't you call me?
...Ah shoot, knew I forgot to give you a charger...
I see you're wearing your X-Transceiver! Pretty cool, isn't it?
You want me to call you 'master'? Show me your entry in the Hall of Fame.
You want me to call you what? Nope, not happenin'.
...Yyyyyeah, no. I'm not calling you that.
So are you poking fun at me because I never knew my dad, or are you just being a pervert? Either way I'm not impressed.
...Yeah, I'm not calling you that.

Shouldn't we wait for the others to arrive, or...

Let the battle--
...Er, let the {b}game{!reset} begin!
I've never backed down from a challenge, ~player~. I hope you're ready!
Let's see which one of us luck favors, ~player~!
This'll be interesting, I just know it...!

Alright, here goes nothin'! Go, Samurott--
...Oh yeah, this isn't a battle. Never mind!
Let's have a thrilling time tonight!
This year, I've decided to go as a mix of two things I have a soft spot for: A film noir detective, and a Mightyena.

...Yeah, I'm fine with not going Fight-or-Frighting this year, I'm actually at a party right now. Okay, see ya.
{ringtone}*Beep*{!reset}
...Okay, where were we?
I spent a lot of time putting this costume together, so I'm gonna whup everyone here so I don't have to take any of it off.
Suuuuure, you should totally go for it.

I won't even need to swap any cards to win this round!
This hand's good as is...

I'll put this card up for Wonder Trade...
Nothing ventured, nothing gained... A new hand, please!
May as well try my luck, rather than these cards... I'll take a new hand.

I'll take ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~, if you don't mind.

Hope you're ready for a Tri Attack!
Looks like it's time for a Triple Finish...
This is an ideal hand to start the game with...

This hand'll be super effective!
Get ready to faint when you see these cards, ~player~!
This hand'll be a real Knockout!
This'll be a winner for sure!
Looks like I didn't need my lucky hat to get a good hand!

Guess some of my hat's luck must've rubbed off on me, huh?
This hand is like getting a full-sized chocolate bar!
How fitting, looks like I've got myself a treat.
Looks like you're all in for a trick...
Not the best way to start the game, but definitely not the worst.
This is an alright hand to start with, hopefully the rest of the game will be okay for me too.
Well, this'll do alright.
Not good, but not terrible. It'll do.
Ah well, as long as it's not a losing hand.
"It's more important to master the cards you're holding than to complain about the ones your opponents were dealt". A friend told me that, once.
Should've expected as much without my hat...
I was joking before, but I guess my hat really was bringing me good luck...
When I said my hat was lucky, I meant it as like I felt luckier when I had it... Now I think it might really be good luck.
This can work. I'll make it work.
Just like a Mightyena, I'm waiting for the right time to strike...
It doesn't have to be the best hand, it just has to not be the worst.
THIS is my first hand? That's not a good omen...
...Not the best of starts, here.

...Right...?
This hand is Trubbish...!
Might as well just throw this hand away and strip...

Maybe if I...

(Play it cool, Hilbert... Maybe they won't know your hand is trash...)

Hey, ~player~...
Feel like swapping some cards with me...?
Uh... Anyone feel like trading hands...?

There's gotta be a way for me to play this hand better--
...Nope, it's a goner.

I knew it...
My luck is Trubbish without my hat.
I wish I could've kept my hat, at least...
...Yep, I'm screwed.

...Yep, I'm screwed. Wish I kept the hat...

Come on, let's get this over with.

...Everything okay over there, N? I thought you might've been a little happier to see me after all this time.
Hey N, I can't help but feel you're avoiding me right now... Something the matter...?
Wait, what?! N, I promise that's not the case! I was going to search for you regardless, to make sure you were alright!
Man, I can't believe how long it's been... And to finally reunite here, of all places! Funny, isn't it N?
Y'know, I met a guy in Kalos that said you taught him how to play that tune of yours... Nearly made me bawl like a Bonsly when I heard it.
I don't suppose you've heard of that 'Aether Paradise' place over in Alola, eh N? It sounded like just your kinda place, at least on the surface...
Man, N... Just seeing you again's really got the memories flowing...

Well, I mean technically yeah...
But I promised myself that if they ever told me to arrest you, I'd quit on the spot and go on the run with you if that's what it took to make sure you were alright.
Hey, I'm just happy to see you again after all this time, pal.
So N, been a while since we last met... How's it going? I've been doing a lot of traveling myself these past few years, got a job with International Police tracking down Team Plasma members...

In my world, the largest aquatic Pokémon is Wailord; They grow to an average of 47 feet long! Second largest is Primal Kyogre, but that doesn't quite count since it isn't always that big. After that it's School Form Wishiwashi, but technically that's just a whole lot of little Wishiwashi acting as one Pokémon. So I guess the next-largest aquatic Pokémon would have to be Milotic, then; it can grow up to twenty feet in length! This is another big long text box and not something like a bug, so please don't report this as a bug!
And if you see a bunch of funny pebbles and rocks on the beach, chances are it's actually a pod of Dwebble!
Tirtouga were actually some of the longest-lived Pokémon of their era! Even though they're extinct, you can still revive them from fossils, so I guess they still live on to this day in a way!
Slowpoke can regrow their tails as well! It's just very slow, like everything else with Slowpoke.
Did you know Starmie and Staryu communicate by beaming very precise radio waves at each other? Sometimes they beam radio waves into the night sky, but nobody knows why that is...
Erm... I'm sure she's just fine, ~mom_alola~...
I haven't been home in at least two years and I'm okay, I'm sure your daughter's doing just fine...
I dunno, you seem like you're worth the wait!
Tom Jones is dead!? Remind me to sell off my Tom Jones memorabilia after this game, I'm gonna be rich!

You lucky Herdier, you... Good luck, ~leon~!

Ya don't say...
...No, really?

I honestly feel kinda bad for you...

...This is a regular issue, is it...?

...Hit me.

Heyyyyy, who's the cutie...?

No kidding! Well I'm certainly glad he wasn't on his own all this time!
Y'know Rosa, for some reason I had it in my head that your name was Mei.

Mei? Sounds sorta familiar...
Hey Rosa, you ever hear that name before?

{ringtone}*Beep*{!reset}
{small}Hey boss, we've got a situation. I've got a visual on ~spy~ right now, but I don't think I've been made.{!reset}

Go right ahead! I mean we're all here to get our rocks off anyway, so maybe your dancing'll do it for someone.

With the size of Pokémon like Spinarak and Galvantula, I don't think they can even fit in there...
...Joltik, though...
I'm just glad there's not nearly as many Durants out there, they're not friendly at all...
Same with Pokémon like Trubbish and Garbodor! Even though they're really smelly, they actually help keep their environments clean by eating garbage!
I bet every bar in Alola's got a pic of that thing on their 'do not serve' wall...

So, I take it you've already done your rounds?
I certainly hope you don't have any Flying or Fire-type enemies...

Odd sort of activity to be praying during, but okay...
I have met a couple Magnemites... They look sorta like you, but they float and don't talk at all...
Well, I know which one you'd be...
If it's not Pokémon, then it's definitely Unovan history! Did you know that Relic Castle is actually the remains of an ancient city dating back to the time of the Two Brothers?
Well in that case, I'll go with a soda!
Hmm... Do they do Oran Juice and Ginger Ale here?

I don't know how, but it's even bigger than Hilda's!
...Wait, I didn't mean to say that out loud...!
I mean, not every guy's tastes are gonna be the same... Just find one who likes the same stuff you do. Trust me, there's bound to be at least one out there.
At the risk of sounding corny... Just be yourself. Any guy worth keeping will be one who likes you for who you are, not who you pretend to be.
...Something tells me you're not looking for a meaningful, life-long relationship with a guy...
I mean there are probably tons of guys that just want a one-night stand, if that's all you're after.
Honestly man, I'll go with anyone as long as they're not a jerk. I haven't had a boyfriend in a while, and a girlfriend in even longer.
Now where's she going...?
You're a smug piece of work, aren't you...
I knew someone who treated his team with the same disdain as you, ~chazz~. He was a tyrant. Thankfully, I managed to beat him.
Your total lack of respect to your team is nothing short of despicable.
Sweet mother of Mew--!
Oh, sweet Arceus--!
Is what's left of Team Plasma's castle old enough for you? Because I helped ruin that place pretty thoroughly.
Well, the fat guy that hangs around the town square back in Nuvema keeps saying that we're all just in a video game. I mean, c'mon! That's just silly!
I'm sure you've heard about this one, but I've always loved the story of Unova's Twin Kings... So dramatically tragic to hear about two brothers turning on each other like that...
That's kinda what I was afraid of. ...You figure the job's still valid though, right? I swear, if this means I don't get paid for some of the stuff I've been through...

There's a really curvy statue of Meloetta on display at the Nacrene Museum...
...N-Not that I've paid too much attention to it...
Why yes, yes you should. Funny, it took me one of the toughest battles of my life to truly understand that.
If you're interested in biology at all, the Pokémon in my world are totally worth studying! A good chunk of them can breathe fire regularly, for starters...
My condolences... It's a little early in comparison to other worlds, but where I'm from it's common to leave home as a teenager to travel the country.
I know that feeling alright! Like when you're on the ropes in a battle, then you come up with the perfect strategy to win!
Every now and then I catch myself humming this beat I heard in Driftveil City...

♫/I wanna be the very best,/
/Like no-one ever was.../

Well, I suppose that's one way to look at it!
A lot more poetic than I was thinking, but I'm glad to see we're on the same page!
I know my hair's kinda messy, but I doubt it can talk...
Did a Psychic-type scramble this guy's brains?
I'm a pro with a Pokéball, whether it's catching or battling!
Sure, I can't pass down that sorta invite. Mind if I let my friend Grimsley know?

Can't go wrong with "Full-Metal Cop"! It's got robots, cops, robot cops...!
That's a tough one... I'd like to think that there'd still be some bit of unique 'you-ness' in the other version, but who knows...
Awww, she's so cute! She reminds me of an Emolga I used to have... I hope she doesn't shock you when she gets upset, though.
If flower-like Pokémon count, then I've always loved how graceful Lilligant look...
I've got a friend in Johto, if you'd like I can see if he can get you your own Sunflora...
I mean I know Pokémon can be dangerous, but I try NOT to kill people with them...!
No, but that bastard Ghetsis nearly killed me. He kept instructing his Pokémon to aim at me during our battle...
No, but I can only hope that Ghetsis is lying in a ditch somewhere. World's better off without guys like that...
Thankfully, not yet. International Police can be a dangerous job, but thankfully most people are smart enough to give up when their team's been defeated.
Well if you're ever in Unova, I'd definitely check out Shopping Mall Nine. It's a little remote, but it's worth the trek.

...Wait, wait.
Wives? ...You mean like, one's your ex or something, right...?
...I take it yours is smoother than a baby Igglybuff...?

That it does, that it does... Of course, there's usually worse consequences for not telling the truth.
Don't sweat it, plenty of Pokémon don't know how to use Surf.
Well, at least people won't wanna make you their TM slave...

Because morality is one of the things mankind adopted when it came into its own as a species. For all our collective boasting about how advanced we are, we should at least be able to act the part as well.
Immortality's more of a curse than a blessing from what I've heard... I'd certainly be in no rush to find out if I were immortal or not.
That's real interesting, Mary... Why not find out whether or not you're immortal first, instead of dragging ~player~ into it?
Humans are social creatures by nature; we're inclined to help one another out when we need it. The only thing that egoism is good for is making sure you spend the rest of your days alone.
I knew someone who thought like that... It was his refusal to understand, or even consider other people that turned out to be one of his weaknesses.
Ignore him, ~alien~. Colress just wants to lock you up and/or dissect you. The ends justify the means for him, if his employment record is anything to go by...
Ignore him, ~alien~. Colress just wants to lock you up and/or dissect you. The ends justify the means for him, if his employment record is anything to go by...
Twin sister, huh...? So for all we know, {b}you{!reset} could be Ryou, taking your sister's place at this game!

A twin sister...? So who's to say {b}you're{!reset} not the twin sister, taking your own twin sister's place here!

Poker's such an interesting game, don't you think? It all comes down to luck and a working knowledge of the rules... It's like the opposite of a Pokémon Battle!
With Poker, there's no need to worry about type match-ups and status effects, it's all dependent on the cards you get. I can see why people like this game so much...
This game... It's so fascinating. The most strategy you need to worry about is what cards to swap. A newcomer and a veteran poker player have the same odds of winning, it just depends on the cards!

In a Pokémon battle, there's all sorts of things that can influence who the winner will be. What team you've got, the moves they know, and how skilled you are with them. But in poker, it's anyone's game...!
In a Pokémon battle, sometimes the outcome can be decided in just a couple turns. But with Poker... Your fortune can be turned on its head in the space of a few rounds!
No strategizing and counter-strategizing, no worrying about a Pokémon's stats, no thinking about what moves to teach them... In this game, it's just down to luck, isn't it...?
Even now, there's no guaranteeing who will win this game... An underdog can come out on top, someone who was leading can be the first to lose, all with the right or wrong cards...
What an interesting game... All our strategies and planning amount to nothing, if we don't get the right hand... It's really anyone's game, the whole way through!

If you ever go to Johto, you have to visit Ecruteak City. The way the sun casts light on Tin Tower in the evening...
Ever hear of the Goldenrod Radio Hostage Crisis? It's a case that everyone in International Police studies.
We've got a special informant helping us fight Team Rocket in Johto. I can't say much more about them, but it's said they have a special relation to Team Rocket's leader, Giovanni.
Johto's seriously such a beautiful place... Just watch out when you pass by any sunflower fields though, chances are at least a quarter of them are actually Sunflora.
I met that Steven Stone guy once, I was helping stop a ring of jewel thieves. Nice guy, handsome too, but sorta odd. Guess that's just the rich for you.
I've gotta say, my favorite region outside of Unova has gotta be Hoenn. It's just so... Vibrant and cheerful there!
I really feel for Hoenn, y'know... Most regions just have one team full of weirdos messing things up, but they have two...
Life in Mossdeep seems pretty relaxing... At least, until they launch another rocket over at the Space Center.
Tabitha... Who names their son that? The guy looks like a human Hariyama too, so you know he must've been bullied something fierce as a kid.
That Courtney in Team Magma is one odd Ducklett... She sounds like a robot, the way she talks. Wouldn't surprise me if she actually was one.

Even though she doesn't look like one, Team Aqua's admin Shelly used to be a respected scientist.
Brains and beauty... what a dangerous combination.
I'll be honest: Matt, the big guy in Team Aqua scares me a little. Dude's built like a Machoke, he could probably snap someone in half with his bare hands, no Pokémon needed.
Apparently there was a second guy named Archie, claiming to run Team Aqua. If he was trying to impersonate the real Archie, then he did a real bad job...
Maxie, the leader of Team Magma may look like a nerd, but he's no pushover. That Camerupt of his is a real powerhouse...
Y'know, Brawly's gym in Dewford Town is the first gym I've ever seen that was actually, well... a gym.
I heard a rumor that the entire concept of Pokédexes originated in Sinnoh...
Did you know that there was a variant of Samurott that used to live in the Sinnoh region?
I loved being in Sinnoh, the place has so much history in it... I wasn't a fan of how chilly it could get, though.
Weirdest part of being in Sinnoh was seeing Mt. Coronet on the horizon, no matter where in the region you were...
Apparently Team Galactic is descended from a group of settlers who helped develop what we now know as Sinnoh. That's gotta sting, having such an integral part of your history turn rogue.
The leader of Team Galactic, Cyrus? Man, he gives me the creeps. it's like he's drilling a hole right through you whenever he looks at you.
The Laventon Institute is one of the oldest Pokémon Research Organizations in the world... Sinnoh's just filled with old stuff, isn't it...
I've been to Virbank before they got that gym... Between that and Pokéstar Studios being closed at the time, there wasn't really much point going there.
Ever been to Village Bridge, ~player~? The name kinda speaks for itself. It's got a great restaurant that I used to work at as a waiter...
Ever been to a Pokémon musical, ~player~? They're great! My team and I have been in quite a few ourselves, it's always so fun to get to dress up and perform...
Every now and then, I can't help but think of this tune I heard in Driftveil City... It's so catchy!
Someone said there's a new underwater bridge in Unova... I've gotta go see that sometime!
Pokéstar Studios reopened while I was away... I hope I can still audition for a role there someday.
I hope Black City's been doing alright while I've been gone...
I heard that the World Tournament Stadium down in Driftveil is open. I'll have to check that out...
Word of advice? Don't go to the Mistralton City gym. Seriously, whose bright idea was it to make people get shot out of cannons there?
I heard Ingo from the Battle Subway in Nimbasa hasn't been seen for a while. I hope he's alright...
I'm glad Burgh changed the design of his gym, I did not enjoy walking through those walls of honey.
The Striaton Gym's shut down as a gym now, but I hope it's still open as a restaurant...
When I get to go back to Unova, I've really gotta try the Battle Subway again.
I'm originally from a little place called Nuvema Town, but I feel more at home in big cities like Castelia...
Man, Lenora's gym back in Nacrene City was the coolest... A secret library with even more secret bookshelf-doors in it? What could possibly beat that?
I hear there's this fad online where people take videos of their Furret walking around Accumula Town. It's actually pretty cute!
Outside of the former gym/restaurant, I'd have to say my favorite part of Striaton City would be the gardens.
It might be a plain, sleepy little town, but my hometown of Nuvema has a great view of the ocean!
Y'know, I still dunno what happened at the Dreamyard to make it look that busted-up... I mean it was just a regular research lab.
I heard Team Plasma came back with a flying pirate ship, of all things... I could've sworn they were ruined after I beat them the first time 'round.
Back home in Unova, Nacrene City's called the 'City of Artists'. Sorta funny that Burgh didn't end up being a gym leader there, huh...
All the big cities in Unova have their own airports, but Mistralton International Airport is definitely the biggest one.
I might be a small-town boy, but my heart belongs to Castelia City. I dunno, it just feels so... Lively.
Don't get me wrong, Nimbasa's a great place, but I wouldn't say it's worth spending an entire vacation there.
Icirrus City might not have a lot of tourist attractions, but it's a nice place to visit. Just make sure you have a warm coat when you do, it can get pretty chilly there!
Opelucid's such an interesting city. They call it 'The Crossroads of Time' for a reason: Sometimes, just crossing the street there feels like stepping from the past into the future.
Y'know, there's actually a painting hanging in the Lumiose Art Gallery of me and a friend of mine taking on the Battle Subway back home.
When I was in Kalos, I came across someone who played me a tune they said they'd learnt from another traveler. I just know that traveler was someone I've been searching for for a long time...
Kalos had some great food, I hope I get assigned there again...
I was undercover in Kalos' Battle Maison for a while, disguised as a Rich Boy... I hated having to act like a snob.
I got a pair of those 'Retracting Rollerskates' that fit onto your shoes when I was in Kalos... But I sucked at using them, so I stuck with my bike.
The gardens in Kalos' Parfum Palace have two big statues of Reshiram and Zekrom. I was gonna show them the real deal, but my boss Looker said no.
Those malasadas they have in Alola are delicious! I'm surprised they've never really made it big internationally...
Don't tell anyone this, but once I went undercover as an employee at the Aether Foundation, in Alola...

Wish I could've done more R+R in Alola, it's like the place was made for vacationing in...
...Unfortunately, I was on Ultra Beast cleanup duty.
I was going to go check out the Battle Tree while I was visiting Alola, but it seemed way too intense...
Ever heard of 'The Masked Royal'? He's the star of Alola's Battle Royale tournaments. I don't have a clue who's under the mask though, even with my detective skills...
Professor Burnet over in Alola studies other dimensions... She used to have a lab in downtown Castelia City, Unova, but everyone was worried that a giant monster would drop right on top of it.
Just about every building in Galar is earthquake-proofed, even though there's no faultlines. It's because Dynamaxed Pokémon can stomp with the force of an earthquake.
The flight to Galar was so exciting, before we even touched down in Wyndon I could see Dynamaxed Pokémon duking it out in the stadium...
I was barely able to even enter Galar, actually... My team wasn't allowed in for some reason. It wasn't until I finally convinced them I was International Police that they let me past customs.
For some reason, Galarians think they invented the concept of camping... I used to camp in Pinwheel Forest all the time when I was on my journey.
Motostoke, over in Galar is such a time capsule of a city... I was half tempted to buy a top-hat that had a bunch of gears and a steam whistle on it while I was there.
I get that Spikemuth is the home of Galar's Dark-type Gym, but did the place really need to be completely covered up? It looks like a war swept through there already...
Postwick was such a charming, sleepy little place... It was like something out of The Hoopa's Ring.
I really wish I could go back home to Unova sometime soon... I haven't been there in years.

Oh, Rosa lost the round then? Phew, you had me worried for a moment...
I'm pretty sure I passed the 'Grand Master' title over to Rosa, but thanks for remembering.
Well, there's a friend I've been looking for for a while now, I actually became a detective in the first place to try and find him.

condition.saying: Are you starting to feel the pressure of playing against me?

case.state: Don't flatter yourself, ~cynthia~. It was bad luck that made me lose, not you.

I'll admit you're beautiful, but you're really overestimating how much it's affected my luck.
...Remind me again which one of us is playing with themselves right now, and which one is still playing poker?

...Do NOT talk to me about the Light Stone.

...I can't help but feel like I've heard that before...

Well yeah, at least where I come from. Women too, actually. Training, or any other sort of interacting with Pokémon is the cornerstone of our society.
Whoa, whoa... I'm no poacher, and I don't cage anything! We do our best to respect Pokémon, they're the ones that can breathe fire and shoot lightning, after all...

Oh, y'know... A little bit of undercover work here, tracking down a few criminals there... Just regular International Police work, really.

Well, I used to tell myself it was so I could find a friend that went missing... But the truth is I'm not sure I'm ready to go back home just yet.
After all that stuff with Team Plasma, it just... didn't feel the same. Didn't feel 'right', you know? Like... Like it wasn't really 'home' anymore.

New York... That's the one with all the skyscrapers n' bridges, right? Closest we've got is Castelia City, but I'm actually from a little place downstate from there called Nuvema Town.

I'm a Pokémon trainer, I'm no stranger to having to work for what I want...

Man, I wish my job were that simple! I'm sure you'd make a good detective as well, a navigator like you would definitely be perceptive enough for the job.
No clue, the foundation's president just really liked 'em I guess. We teamed up with these rangers from another dimension though, and they helped get those beasts back where they belong.

I was in Team Plasma's Castle, me and Reshiram versus N and Zekrom in a literal battle of Truth and Ideals... I'd just managed to win, when Ghetsis starts laughing to himself.
He says that the only people who know I'd won are himself, N and me, and that he can just get rid of us and make up his own story.
So, he sends out his own Pokémon and tells them to get rid of us...

So Team Plasma had declared war on Unova, pulled a castle outta the ground around Victory Road. I head there to stop them, and find myself in the most important battle I've ever fought: Me and Reshiram vs. N and Zekrom.
I manage to win, when that bastard Ghetsis gets an idea: Kill the both of us, say N won but tragically perished, then take over directly.
To be honest though, I'm more about the truth. I've got ideals too, of course, but I try not to let them blind me to what's true.
Personally, I prefer the truth. Ideals are fine to have, but they won't count for much if they don't align with what's true.
I'm all for the truth, myself. After all, ideals don't mean much if they're ignorant of what's objectively true.
Personally, I'd prefer knowing the truth instead of being blinded by my own ideals.
See, I'm all for the truth. Ideals change from person to person, but the truth is the truth no matter what.
Better to trust what you know is a fact than to take a gamble on something potentially false, right? Of course, I guess the best choice is a balance of both.
I'm with you there. Ideals are great, but the truth always wins out in the end. Then again it's best to have a healthy blend of both, right? Follow your own principles, but don't deny what's real.
...The 'cowardice' was only because I wasn't expecting to see a proper royal here, of all places... Surely your highness has better things to do than disrobe herself?
I mean it is amazing, no doubt there. I'm just not into the whole "Slut of the Seven Seas" look you've got going on.
Sure, I'll admit it. Doesn't mean I don't think you look like a pirate stripper, though.

His Bisharp goes in for the kill on N, and I manage to get between them... Nearly got impaled on the damn thing. It could've been worse though; It could've hurt N instead.
